docs.snippet: When Pope Francis visits the United States this fall, he can expect the same rock-star adulation that greets him wherever he goes. But his positions on hot-button issues such as the death penalty and climate change could quickly set the stage for ...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Pope Francis visits the United States this fall, he can expect the same rock-star adulation that greets him wherever he goes. But his positions on hot-button issues such as the death penalty and climate change could quickly set the stage for conflict. That may explain why Francis has been clearing the decks on a host of less high-profile matters of contention that could also have marred the visit.

headline.main: Pope Stokes Flames Ahead of US Trip Even as He Ends Problems
headline.print_headline: Pope Stokes Flames Ahead of US Trip Even as He Ends Problems

docs.snippet: Baltimore prosecutor Marilyn Mosby stole the spotlight on Friday with her surprisingly swift decision to bring criminal charges against six police officers in the arrest and death in April of a 25-year-old black man....

headline.main: Baltimore Prosecutor Learned Life's Lessons in Boston 'Police House'

docs.snippet: The use of police force against minorities and whites alike is poorly tracked, but what data does exist suggests the number of law-enforcement homicides have risen only slowly, if at all....
docs.lead_paragraph: The use of police force against minorities and whites alike is poorly tracked, but what data does exist suggests the number of law-enforcement homicides have risen only slowly, if at all.
docs.abstract: Data suggests that rate of police killings has risen only slightly since 2009, or not at all, despite public impression that phenomenon has accelerated following death of Michael Brown in 2014; authoritative data on use of lethal force by police is lacking nationwide, but analysis shows it is in fact an old and steady problem, and that apparent uptick is likely due to increased awareness from cell phone videos.

headline.main: Police Killings Rise Slightly, Though Increased Focus May Suggest Otherwise
headline.print_headline: Police Killings Rising Slightly, Data Suggests

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and SARAH COHEN
